title: Understanding Instructional Design Theory and Research-Based Practice: Applications in Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic curriculum design skills and general understanding of learning theories
context.additional_context: Exploration of instructional design theories and research-based approaches required for language education design in blended environments utilizing digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of instructional design theory (context, perspectives, issues clusters, methodologies, values).
Learners can analyze the impact of learning theories and social assumptions on language education design.
Learners can apply instructional design theories to real-world language education scenarios through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
